snippet: Ahead of a league meeting, the N.F.L. commissioner asked owners to consider what role the league should have in investigating player conduct.
abstract: NFL Commissioner Roger Goodell asks team owners to consider new system that will use outside experts to decide suspension for players who violate league's personal conduct policy; suggestion precedes first league-wide meeting since firestorm following release of video showing Baltimore Ravens running back Ray Rice assaulting his then-fiancee.
lead_paragraph: Ahead of a league meeting, the N.F.L. commissioner asked owners to consider what role the league should have in investigating player conduct.

headline.main: Roger Goodell Asks N.F.L. Owners to Ponder a Revised Discipline System
headline.print_headline: Owners Are Asked to Ponder a Revised Discipline System
